statement:
Let $Ax=b$ be the matrix form of a system of $n$ linear equations in $n$
unknowns, with $x$ and $b$ as $n\times 1$ column vectors and $A$ an
$n \times n$ matrix. If $\det(A)\ne 0$, then this system has a unique
solution, and for each $i$ ($1\le i \le n$) ,

$$x_i = \frac{\det(M_i)}{\det(A)}$$

where $M_i$ is $A$ with column $i$ replaced by $b$.
